intro: Eriogonum thornei, commonly known as the Thorne's buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has a short, upright stem with spiny bracts that protect its flowers. Eriogonum thornei plays an important role in its ecosystem by providing nectar for pollinators and stabilizing soil in disturbed areas.
